elective_type_1.name: Any 300-level Course
elective_type_1.description: Any 300-level course (or two 15-credit courses) from any department

courses.name: Financial Management
courses.description: Apply financial theory to capital budgeting and investment decisions. Enhances quantitative finance skills for corporate finance analytics.

courses.name: Auditing and Assurance
courses.description: Understand audit procedures and risk assessment frameworks. Useful for data quality assurance and fraud detection analytics.

courses.name: Valuation and Securities Analysis
courses.description: Value companies and analyze investment opportunities. Applies statistical methods to financial markets and portfolio analytics.

courses.name: Accounting: Markets and Organisations
courses.description: Explore accounting's role in organizational decision-making. Bridges financial data with business context for integrated analytics.

courses.name: Development Management
courses.description: Learn project management in development contexts. Useful for managing data-driven development projects and NGO partnerships.

courses.name: International Economics
courses.description: Understand global trade dynamics, exchange rates, and international policy frameworks. Essential for data-driven analysis of cross-border business operations and economic indicators.

courses.name: Behavioural Economics
courses.description: Apply statistical methods to analyze human decision-making patterns. Crucial for predictive modeling of consumer behavior and business strategy optimization.

courses.name: Industrial Economics
courses.description: Analyze market structures, competition, and firm behavior using economic models. Valuable for understanding business environments and competitive analytics.

courses.name: Monetary Economics
courses.description: Study central banking, inflation, and monetary policy impacts on markets. Important for financial analytics and macroeconomic forecasting models.

courses.name: Mathematical Economics
courses.description: Master advanced mathematical techniques for economic modeling. Strengthens quantitative reasoning essential for complex data science applications in economics.

courses.name: Applied Microeconomics
courses.description: Apply econometric methods to real-world microeconomic problems. Bridges theory with practical data analysis skills for business decision-making.

courses.name: Dissertation
courses.description: Conduct independent research on a topic of your choice. Develops research skills, critical thinking, and ability to execute end-to-end data science projects.

courses.name: Corporate Finance
courses.description: Advanced corporate finance topics including M&A and restructuring. Useful for financial advisory and corporate strategy analytics.

courses.name: Quantitative Finance
courses.description: Apply advanced quantitative methods to financial problems. High-demand skills for quantitative analyst and financial engineering roles.

courses.name: Investments and Portfolio Management
courses.description: Manage investment portfolios using quantitative optimization. Applies machine learning and statistical methods to asset allocation.

courses.name: Derivatives & Risk Management
courses.description: Price derivatives and manage financial risk using quantitative models. Critical for risk analytics and financial derivatives trading roles.

courses.name: Security in International Relations
courses.description: Study security threats and defense strategies. Relevant for cybersecurity analytics and risk assessment roles.

courses.name: Power Shift in International Relations
courses.description: Examine changing global power dynamics. Important for understanding emerging markets and international business trends.

courses.name: International Political Economy
courses.description: Analyze trade, finance, and global economic governance. Bridges politics and economics for comprehensive business analytics.

courses.name: Research Project in Digital Innovation
courses.description: Execute independent digital innovation research project. Develops project execution and technical research capabilities.

courses.name: Management and Innovation of eBusiness
courses.description: Study digital business models and e-commerce strategies. Applicable to digital marketing analytics and online business optimization.

courses.name: Management and Social Media
courses.description: Analyze social media platforms and digital communities. Directly applicable to social media analytics and sentiment analysis projects.

courses.name: The Law of Business Organisations
courses.description: Understand legal frameworks governing corporations and contracts. Critical for data analysts working in compliance, risk management, and corporate governance.

courses.name: Organisation Theory: An Interdisciplinary Approach
courses.description: Analyze organizational structures and behaviors from multiple perspectives. Enhances ability to interpret workplace dynamics data and improve organizational analytics.

courses.name: Marketing Management
courses.description: Learn marketing strategies and consumer analytics. Directly applicable to customer segmentation, campaign analysis, and marketing optimization projects.

courses.name: Entrepreneurship
courses.description: Develop entrepreneurial thinking and startup strategies. Useful for data scientists considering business ventures or working in innovation-driven environments.

courses.name: Operations Management
courses.description: Optimize business processes and supply chains using quantitative methods. Perfect for applying analytics to logistics, inventory, and operational efficiency.

courses.name: Human Resource Management
courses.description: Study workforce planning, talent analytics, and employee performance metrics. Valuable for HR analytics and people data science roles.

courses.name: Strategy
courses.description: Formulate competitive strategies using analytical frameworks. Combines business acumen with data-driven strategic planning essential for business analysts.

courses.name: Game Theory
courses.description: Model strategic interactions and decision-making scenarios. Applicable to pricing strategies, negotiations, and competitive market analysis.

courses.name: Optimisation Theory
courses.description: Master optimization algorithms for resource allocation and decision problems. Core skill for operations research and machine learning optimization tasks.

courses.name: Mathematics of Finance and Valuation
courses.description: Apply mathematical models to financial instruments and asset valuation. Essential for quantitative finance and financial data science careers.

courses.name: Further Mathematics for Economists
courses.description: Deepen mathematical foundations for economic analysis. Strengthens analytical capabilities crucial for advanced econometric and statistical modeling.

courses.name: Democracy and Democratisation
courses.description: Analyze democratic transitions and governance quality. Relevant for political risk analysis and governance metrics.

elective_type_2.name: Any Course
elective_type_2.description: Any course from the available options

courses.name: Principles of Accounting
courses.description: Master financial statements and accounting principles. Essential for understanding business financials and building financial analytics dashboards.

courses.name: Financial Reporting
courses.description: Analyze corporate financial reports and accounting standards. Critical for extracting insights from financial data and automated reporting systems.

courses.name: Management Accounting
courses.description: Learn cost analysis, budgeting, and performance measurement. Valuable for business intelligence and managerial decision support analytics.

courses.name: Financial Management
courses.description: Apply financial theory to capital budgeting and investment decisions. Enhances quantitative finance skills for corporate finance analytics.

courses.name: Auditing and Assurance
courses.description: Understand audit procedures and risk assessment frameworks. Useful for data quality assurance and fraud detection analytics.

courses.name: Valuation and Securities Analysis
courses.description: Value companies and analyze investment opportunities. Applies statistical methods to financial markets and portfolio analytics.

courses.name: Accounting: Markets and Organisations
courses.description: Explore accounting's role in organizational decision-making. Bridges financial data with business context for integrated analytics.

courses.name: Introduction to International Development
courses.description: Study global development challenges and policy interventions. Valuable context for social impact analytics and development data projects.

courses.name: Complex Emergencies and Humanitarian Responses
courses.description: Analyze crisis response and humanitarian aid systems. Relevant for working with NGOs and emergency response data analytics.

courses.name: Global Environmental Problems and Politics
courses.description: Examine environmental sustainability and climate policy. Growing field for data scientists in environmental analytics and ESG reporting.

courses.name: Poverty and Development
courses.description: Understand poverty measurement and development economics. Important for social analytics and impact evaluation projects.

courses.name: Development Management
courses.description: Learn project management in development contexts. Useful for managing data-driven development projects and NGO partnerships.

courses.name: Macroeconomics
courses.description: Study economic growth, unemployment, and fiscal policy. Important for macroeconomic forecasting and policy impact analysis.

courses.name: Microeconomics
courses.description: Analyze consumer and firm behavior using mathematical models. Foundation for pricing analytics and market mechanism design.

courses.name: Elements of Econometrics
courses.description: Apply regression analysis and statistical inference to economic data. Core methodology for causal inference and predictive modeling in business. (Year 2 elective option - take if you didn't choose it before)

courses.name: The World Economy from the Industrial Revolution to the Present
courses.description: Understand long-term economic trends and historical patterns. Provides context for time series analysis and economic trend forecasting.

courses.name: International Economics
courses.description: Understand global trade dynamics, exchange rates, and international policy frameworks. Essential for data-driven analysis of cross-border business operations and economic indicators.

courses.name: Behavioural Economics
courses.description: Apply statistical methods to analyze human decision-making patterns. Crucial for predictive modeling of consumer behavior and business strategy optimization.

courses.name: Industrial Economics
courses.description: Analyze market structures, competition, and firm behavior using economic models. Valuable for understanding business environments and competitive analytics.

courses.name: Monetary Economics
courses.description: Study central banking, inflation, and monetary policy impacts on markets. Important for financial analytics and macroeconomic forecasting models.

courses.name: Mathematical Economics
courses.description: Master advanced mathematical techniques for economic modeling. Strengthens quantitative reasoning essential for complex data science applications in economics.

courses.name: Applied Microeconomics
courses.description: Apply econometric methods to real-world microeconomic problems. Bridges theory with practical data analysis skills for business decision-making.

courses.name: Dissertation
courses.description: Conduct independent research on a topic of your choice. Develops research skills, critical thinking, and ability to execute end-to-end data science projects.

courses.name: Introduction to Finance
courses.description: Learn financial markets, instruments, and valuation principles. Foundation for financial data analysis and fintech applications.

courses.name: Financial Intermediation
courses.description: Understand banking systems and financial institutions. Relevant for risk analytics and financial services data science roles.

courses.name: Principles of Corporate Finance
courses.description: Study capital structure, dividends, and corporate valuation. Key for financial modeling and corporate analytics projects.

courses.name: Principles of Asset Pricing
courses.description: Learn asset pricing models and portfolio theory. Essential for quantitative finance and algorithmic trading analytics.

courses.name: Financial Data Analysis
courses.description: Apply statistical techniques to financial datasets. Directly relevant to financial analytics, time series forecasting, and market analysis.

courses.name: Corporate Finance
courses.description: Advanced corporate finance topics including M&A and restructuring. Useful for financial advisory and corporate strategy analytics.

courses.name: Quantitative Finance
courses.description: Apply advanced quantitative methods to financial problems. High-demand skills for quantitative analyst and financial engineering roles.

courses.name: Investments and Portfolio Management
courses.description: Manage investment portfolios using quantitative optimization. Applies machine learning and statistical methods to asset allocation.

courses.name: Derivatives & Risk Management
courses.description: Price derivatives and manage financial risk using quantitative models. Critical for risk analytics and financial derivatives trading roles.

courses.name: World History since 1945
courses.description: Study post-war global history and geopolitical shifts. Provides context for international business analytics and global trends analysis.

courses.name: International Relations: Theories, Concepts and Debates
courses.description: Understand international relations frameworks. Useful for geopolitical risk analysis and international market analytics.

courses.name: International History since 1945
courses.description: Examine modern international history through research. Develops analytical writing and historical research skills.

courses.name: International Organisations
courses.description: Study UN, WTO, and other global institutions. Relevant for working with international organizations and policy analytics.

courses.name: International Political Theory
courses.description: Explore justice, rights, and global governance theories. Useful for ethics in AI and responsible data science practices.

courses.name: International Organisations
courses.description: Study international institutions and global governance. Context for policy data analysis and international development projects.

courses.name: Foreign Policy Analysis
courses.description: Analyze state decision-making in international affairs. Applicable to geopolitical forecasting and scenario planning analytics.

courses.name: Security in International Relations
courses.description: Study security threats and defense strategies. Relevant for cybersecurity analytics and risk assessment roles.

courses.name: Power Shift in International Relations
courses.description: Examine changing global power dynamics. Important for understanding emerging markets and international business trends.

courses.name: International Political Economy
courses.description: Analyze trade, finance, and global economic governance. Bridges politics and economics for comprehensive business analytics.

courses.name: Introduction to Information Systems
courses.description: Learn how organizations use IT systems and databases. Foundation for understanding data infrastructure and system design.

courses.name: Digital Infrastructures for Business
courses.description: Understand digital platforms and business technology. Relevant for tech-driven business transformation and digital analytics.

courses.name: Innovating Digital Systems and Services
courses.description: Design innovative digital products and services. Useful for product analytics and technology innovation roles.

courses.name: Information Systems Management
courses.description: Manage IT projects and information systems. Important for data team leadership and analytics project management. (Year 2 elective option - take if you didn't choose it before)

courses.name: Research Project in Digital Innovation
courses.description: Execute independent digital innovation research project. Develops project execution and technical research capabilities.

courses.name: Management and Innovation of eBusiness
courses.description: Study digital business models and e-commerce strategies. Applicable to digital marketing analytics and online business optimization.

courses.name: Management and Social Media
courses.description: Analyze social media platforms and digital communities. Directly applicable to social media analytics and sentiment analysis projects.

courses.name: Managerial Economics
courses.description: Apply economic theory to managerial decisions. Combines economics with business strategy for data-driven management.

courses.name: Management Science Methods
courses.description: Use quantitative methods for business optimization. Core operations research skills for analytics and decision science roles.

courses.name: Core Management Concepts
courses.description: Deepen understanding of management theory and practice. Provides business acumen essential for translating data into business value.

courses.name: Data Analysis for Management Decision Making
courses.description: Apply statistical analysis to management problems. Bridges data science with business decision-making and strategy.

courses.description: Study workforce planning, talent analytics, and employee performance metrics. Valuable for HR analytics and people data science roles.

courses.name: Strategy
courses.description: Formulate competitive strategies using analytical frameworks. Combines business acumen with data-driven strategic planning essential for business analysts.

courses.name: Management Mathematics
courses.description: Apply mathematical optimization to business problems. Bridges mathematics with management decision-making and operations.

courses.name: Abstract Mathematics
courses.description: Develop rigorous mathematical proof skills. Enhances logical thinking and theoretical foundations for advanced algorithms. (Year 2 elective option - take if you didn't choose it before)

courses.name: Further Linear Algebra
courses.description: Advanced linear algebra including eigenvalues and matrix decomposition. Critical for dimensionality reduction and recommendation systems.

courses.name: Further Calculus
courses.description: Advanced calculus topics including multivariable optimization. Essential for gradient-based machine learning algorithms.

courses.description: Model strategic interactions and decision-making scenarios. Applicable to pricing strategies, negotiations, and competitive market analysis.

courses.name: Optimisation Theory
courses.description: Master optimization algorithms for resource allocation and decision problems. Core skill for operations research and machine learning optimization tasks.

courses.description: Apply mathematical models to financial instruments and asset valuation. Essential for quantitative finance and financial data science careers.

courses.description: Deepen mathematical foundations for economic analysis. Strengthens analytical capabilities crucial for advanced econometric and statistical modeling.

courses.name: Introduction to International Political Thought
courses.description: Study political philosophy and international thought. Develops critical thinking about governance and policy issues.

courses.name: Introduction to Political Science
courses.description: Learn political systems, institutions, and behavior. Context for public policy analytics and political forecasting.

courses.name: Comparative Politics
courses.description: Compare political systems across countries. Useful for cross-national data analysis and comparative policy research.

courses.name: Democracy and Democratisation
courses.description: Analyze democratic transitions and governance quality. Relevant for political risk analysis and governance metrics.

courses.name: Contemporary Sociology in a Global Age
courses.description: Understand social structures and globalization. Provides social context for demographic and social network analysis.

courses.name: Elements of Social and Applied Psychology
courses.description: Study human behavior and psychological principles. Applicable to user experience research and behavioral data analysis.
